form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Burr (for himself and Mrs. McCaskill) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To amend the Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act to require the Secretary of Defense to inform the Attorney General of persons required to register as sex offenders.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Sex Offender Reporting Act of 2015.

section.header: Registration of sex offenders released from military corrections facilities or upon conviction

subsection.text: The Sex Offender Registration and Notification Act is amended by inserting after section 128 (42 U.S.C. 16928) the following:

section.header: Registration of sex offenders released from military corrections facilities or upon conviction
section.text: The Secretary of Defense shall provide to the Attorney General the information described in section 114 to be included in the National Sex Offender Registry regarding personsâ€”

subparagraph.text: released from military corrections facilities; or
convicted if the sentences adjudged by courts-martial under chapter 47 of title 10, United States Code (the Uniform Code of Military Justice), do not include confinement; and

paragraph.text: required to register under this title.

subsection.text: The table of contents of the Adam Walsh Child Protection and Safety Act is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 128 the following:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 128A. Registration of sex offenders released from military corrections facilities or upon conviction.
